intro: Cynanchum astephanoides, commonly known as the Chinese milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, attracting various pollinators. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. The species is also noted for its medicinal properties in traditional Chinese medicine.
